intro: Rostellularia simplex, commonly known as the slender rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rostellularia simplex is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
